title: Political Science: A Comparative Introduction
A textbook on political science written from a comparative perspective
Political Analysis
Excellent summary and exposition on the purpose and meaning of conducting political analysis
Designing Social Inquiry: Scientific Inference in Qualitative Research
Demanding but worthwhile effort to unify qualitative and quantitative research methods under one logic of inference

note: Advanced text on rational, cultural, and structural theories and how they are used in comparative politics.
title: Comparative Politics: Rationality, Culture, and Structure

note: Excellent reader on the main theories and methods of political science.
title: Theories and Methods in Political Science

container-title: Comparative Political Dynamics: Global Research Perspectives
note: An excellent review of comparative methods.
title: New Perspectives on the Comparative Method’
Case-study and Theory in Political Science’
The most comprehensive review of the scientific value of single-country studies
Some Methodological Problems in Comparative Politics’
This essay outlines the most similar and most different systems design as well as their ‘mirror images’
Comparative Politics and Comparative Method’, The American How to compare countries 35
The original statement about comparative method, locating it as a non-experimental and non-statistical social science
The Comparable Cases Strategy in Comparative Research’
This essay presents further reflections on comparative method

container-title: Theory and Methods in Political Science
title: The Comparative Method’
A brief overview of comparative methods

container-title: The Comparative Political Economy of the Welfare State
title: Introduction to Qualitative Comparative Analysis
This essay distinguishes between ‘variable-oriented’ and ‘case-oriented’ approaches and proposes a way to unify them
Concept Misinformation in Comparative Politics’
The classic statement on ‘conceptual stretching’ and the ‘ladder of abstraction’
Compare Why and How: Comparing, Miscomparing and the Comparative Method’
A restatement of the main claims in 1970 and that ‘to compare is to control’

container-title: Comparative Studies in Society and History
title: The Uses of Comparative History in Macrosocial Inquiry’
This essay outlines the uses of comparative history as well as Mill’s methods of agreement and difference

container-title: Comparative Political Dynamics: Global Research Perspectives
title: New Perspectives on the Comparative Method’
This essay addresses the problems of too many variables and not enough countries
How to Compare Nations: Strategies in Comparative Politics
This book provides a good discussion of establishing functional equivalence in comparative politics
How the Cases You Choose Affect the Answers You Get: Selection Bias in Comparative Politics’
An excellent article on selection bias using real examples from the comparative literature
Political Science: A Comparative Introduction
Chapter 2 makes brief statements about value bias, too many variables not enough countries, and equivalence

note: Chapter 2 provides an exhaustive review of problems with selection bias.
title: Making It Count: The Improvement of Social Research and Theory
History, Historiography, and Political Science: Multiple Historical Records and the Problem of Selection Bias’
Why Men Rebel
This is Gurr’s full theoretical and comparative statement on the motivation for violent political conflict
Patterns of Instability
A comprehensive review of quantitative cross-national studies of political violence
An Evaluation of “Does Economic Inequality Breed Political Conflict” Studies’
A comprehensive review of quantitative cross-national studies on economic inequality and political violence
Social Revolutions in the Modern World
A collection of Skocpol’s essays on social revolution and macro-causal historical comparison
Social Movements: An Introduction
A thorough review of social movement theory and research in advanced industrial democracies
Theorizing Social Movements

note: This volume presents further developments in social movement theory and research.
title: A comprehensive review of social movement theory and its ability to be used in contexts outside North America and Europe
Comparative Perspectives on Social Movements
Power in Movement, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. This work traces the development of social movement theory and research
Developing Democracy: Toward Consolidation
Third Wave, which argues that the third wave of democratization extends in the 1990s, but that the new democracies tend to be electoral democracies and not fully fledged liberal democracies
Democracy’s Victory and Crisis, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. A collection of essays on the political, economic, and cultural aspects of democratization
Transitions to Democracy: Toward A Dynamic Model’
A definitive and concise statement on democratic transition and consolidation with contemporary relevance and applicability
On the Third Wave of Democratization: A Synthesis and Evaluation of Recent Theory and Research’
A review of the main studies of the third wave, including theory, method, and research design

collection-title: A collection of essays on various international aspects of democratization
title: The International Dimensions of Democratization: Europe and the Americas
Institutional Design, Party Systems, and Governability—Differentiating the Presidential Regimes of Latin America’
A comprehensive review of institutional design and democratic performance in Latin America
Constitutional Design and Democratic Performance’

An extension of Lijphart’s (1994b) comparison of eighteen established democracies, which shows the superiority of parliamentary systems and unitary systems across a range of performance indicators intrinsic to liberal democracy, while controlling for regional, cultural, and developmental differences
Patterns of Democracy: Government Forms and Performance in Thirty-Six Countries

A combination of his earlier work (1994a and 1994b), this study compares democratic performance across a range of political dimensions, including party systems, cabinets, executive-legislative relations, electoral systems, interest groups, federal and unitary systems, bicameral and unicameral systems, and macro-economics
Review Article: Divided and Governed? Recent Research on Divided Government in the United States’
A comprehensive review of the origins and consequences of divided government in the United States
Comparative Constitutional Engineering: An Inquiry into Structures, Incentives, and Outcomes
A theoretical and empirical exploration of institutional design and its effects

note: Excellent overview of human rights and their practical implications.
title: Human Rights: Universality in Practice
Human Rights
A good overview and introduction to human rights
Human Rights Horizons: The Pursuit of Justice in a Globalizing World
Excellent overview and examination of the tension between the international law of human rights and the geopolitics of world order
Human Rights in International Relations, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. Introduction to human rights as a challenge to state sovereignty and realist approaches in international relations
Rights
Excellent overview of different categories of rights, including human rights
Human Rights in the World
A summary of human rights and how they are protected in international law

container-title: Comparative Political Dynamics: Global Research Perspectives
title: Global Research Perspectives: Paradigms, Concepts and Data in a Changing World’
An excellent summary of new directions for the field of comparative politics

note: entitled ‘What Globalization Is Not’, is highly recom-mended.
title: False Dawn: The Delusions of Global Capitalism, London: Granta Books. A critical review of globalization and the ‘easy’ association between political freedom and economic freedom

Global Transformations: Politics, Economics, and Culture, Cambridge: Polity Press. A comprehensive study of globalization in the past and in the present, including a survey of arguments relating to globalization, new conceptualizations, and global comparative evidence
Rational Deterrence Theory and Comparative Case Studies’
A Discipline Divided: Schools and Sects in Political Science
